page.title: 02HOUSES IN WILLINGDON
page.content: Most of the older houses are in Church Street where flint has been used quite extensively. A terrace opposite St. Mary's Church has three types of flint facing _ pebbles, random and square. The dates 1611 and 1857 are carved there. In Upper Willingdon, described by Estate Agents as "Olde Worlde Village of Willingdon",panels of flint feature as decorative motifs in more recently built houses, and care has been taken to conform to existing dwellings. The area as a whole contains a good mixture of housing stock. Of the newest houses to be built those at Willingdon Trees are lower_cost type and more modern in style.At Haystoun a group of higher_priced detached houses is nearing completion. Very little building land remains.
